Image by: Gemini Observatory
Do you see that photo above? As far as photos of our universe go, it's pretty blurry and not all that spectacular, except for one little detail: this is the first photo of a planet orbiting a star outside of our solar system. Ever.
The image was taken by three University of Toronto scientists using the Gemini North telescope trained on the distant star (lovingly named '1RXS J160929.1-210524'). Up until this point, the only planet-like objects scientists had clearly observed in space did not appear locked in orbit around a star much like our own sun. This could shake up some widely held astronomical theories though, since the supposed planet is located farther from it's 'sun' than researchers thought possible.
